Description: Fragment of rim and shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery; white slip; inside reserved save red band at top; guilloche with dotted double-outline triangles in interstices on rim, with red detail; tongue frieze at top of shoulder between bands with added red band lined in white; remains of animal frieze, neck and wings of duck or goose below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kardara places this fragment in her 'mixed technique' style (1963, 199-248) and for the attribution see her 237-44. See Fairbanks 1928, 103 no.308.6 and pl. 30 [Boston, MFA 88.968] for cable pattern on a 'low bowl' fragment from the Temple of Hera at Naukratis and 109 no. 320.9 and pl. 34 a shoulder fragment of a large krater with the same composition as ours also from Naukratis. T.J. Smith, "East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens", BSA 104, 2009, 347-348, fig. 3
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 347-8, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.399)
